intro: Sympieza capitellata var. crassistigma, commonly known as the broad-stigma sympieza, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring large, showy bracts that enclose its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in mountainous or forested areas. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to conserve moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered an endangered species.
